column2: ysabella, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I take this for heart palpitations ! It keeps me from having them ! I have had them all of my life, and found out about a heart murmur 3 years ago after an extensive ultrasound , and many other tests by a cardiologist at a hospital. I am 62 years old and I know this works for me. If for some reason I forget this med. I know right away to eat and then take it ! If you take this for the same reason I do , DON'T LAY DOWN FOR 30 MINUTS after ingesting this medication ! Very important ! It's odd , because I eat a high potassium diet ! Blessings to all !

column9: I have Bartters syndrome.  Basically it's a potassium wasting syndrome that is congenital.  I take anywhere from 8 to 10 20MeQ pills A DAY.  Yep that's right a day, and I've done so for several years.  Soft stool now and then, and yes they're not easy to swallow.  I usually take 3 or 4 in a handful at a time with a bunch of water.  I don't always take them with food and have not experienced any real problems.  I wish I could get a larger dose pill and take less pills a day.  Awaiting a whole in my stomach someday!  :)

column2: Irishking, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a Type I insulin dependent diabetic and also underwent cardiac bypass surgery late last year.  I discovered what I was allergic to and causing my intense itching or pruritusit was Klor Con M20, a potassium supplement my Cardiologist put me on along with Lasix 40 mg twice daily, a diuretic late last October.     The doctor, nurses, pharmacist, etc didnt help me identify the allergic reaction I had and I was forced to suffer four (4) months of intense itching all over my body.  I even made two (2) trips to the emergency room at the heart hospital and they couldnt figure it out.

column9: I learned that if I ate something just before I took the caplets, (I take 2 and sometimes 3 at a time) it made it much easier and the other thing was to use a milk jug with about a quart of water in it to drink from.  That way, I for sure had plenty water in case one turned sideways, but also the ability to turn the jug up and straighten the gullet made the pills go down much easier.  I also take 3-4 Calcium Citrate caplets to keep my blood balanced and prevent the cramps that are so bad I break out in a sweat when they hit.  not just in the legs but all over my body.
